intro: Epidendrum chloroleucum var. fuscoluteum, commonly known as the Orange Epidendrum, is a member of the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its vibrant orange and yellow flowers, which bloom in clusters along the stem. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in tropical rainforests. Its leaves are usually dark green and革质 (leathery), providing a contrast to its brightly colored blooms. This variety is prized for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in warm, humid environments.
